HTMLAudioElement.summary: The HTMLAudioElement interface provides access to the properties of audio elements, as well as methods to manipulate them.

remarks.para: This element is based on, and inherits properties and methods from, the interface.

-Web media technologies
-Audio and Video Delivery
-HTML element implementing this interface: audio.

HTMLAudioElementAudio.summary:
The Audio() constructor creates
and returns a new which can be either attached to
a document for the user to interact with and/or listen to, or can be used
offscreen to manage and play audio.

remarks.para:
-Web media technologies
-HTML element implementing this interface: audio.

HTMLAudioElementAudio.returns:
A new object, configured to be used for playing back
the audio from the file specified by url. The new object's
property is set
to auto and its src property is set to the specified URL
or null if no URL is given. If a URL is specified, the browser begins
to asynchronously load the media resource before returning the new object.
